Manifold

Abstract (super-)type under which all speficic manifolds fall

Main.Manifolds.EmbeddedManifold â€” Type
EmbeddedManifold <: Manifold

EmbeddedManifold creates a manifold â„³ = f^{-1}({0}) of dimension d=N-n where $f$ should be a smooth function $â„^N â†’ â„^n$. An EmbeddedManifold â„³ equipped with functions f( , â„³), P( , â„³) and F( , â„³). Here f is such that f(q, â„³)=0 when $qâˆˆâ„³$, P(q, â„³) is the projection matrix $â„^Nâ†’T_qâ„³$ given by $I-n(q)n(q)^T$, where $n(q)=âˆ‡f(q)/|âˆ‡f(q)|$. F(q, â„³) is the transformation from local coordinates q to global coordinates in $â„^N$.

Main.Manifolds.Ellipse â€” Type
Ellipse{T<:Real} <: EmbeddedManifold

Settings for an ellipse as subset of â„Â². Elements satisfy $(x/a)^2 + (y/b)^2 = 1$. For an object ğ”¼ = Ellipse(a, b), we have

  • $f(q, \mathcal{ğ”¼}) = \left(\frac{q_1}{a}\right)^2 + \left(\frac{q_2}{b}\right)^2 - 1$
  • $F(q, ğ”¼) = \begin{pmatrix} a\cos q & b \sin q\end{pmatrix}$

Example: Generate a unit circle

julia> ğ”¼ = Ellipse(1.0, 1.0)
Main.Manifolds.Sphere â€” Type
Sphere{T<:Real} <: EmbeddedManifold

Settings for the sphere ğ•ŠÂ². Call Sphere(R) to generate a sphere with radius R<:Real. Elements satisfy $x^2+y^2+z^2=R^2$. The local coordinates are modelled via a stereograpgical projection.

For a Sphere ğ•Š = Sphere(R), we have

  • $f(q, ğ•Š) = q_1^2+q_2^2-R^2$
  • $F(q, ğ•Š) = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{2q_1}{q_1^2+q_2^2+1} & \frac{2q_2}{q_1^2+q_2^2+1} & \frac{q_1^2+q_2^2-1}{q_1^2+q_2^2+1} \end{pmatrix}$

Example: Generate a unit sphere

julia> ğ•Š = Sphere(1.0)
Main.Manifolds.Torus â€” Type
Torus{T<:Real} <: EmbeddedManifold

Settings for the torus ğ•‹Â² with inner radius $r$ and outer radius $R$. Call Torus(R,r) to generate a torus with inner radius r<:Real and outer radius R<:Real. Elements satisfy $(x^2+y^2+z^2+R^2-r^2)^2=4R^2(x^2+y^2)$.

For a Torus ğ•‹ = Torus(R, r), we have

  • ``f(q, ğ•‹) =

Example: Generate a torus with $R=3$ and $r=1$

julia> ğ•‹ = Torus(3.0, 1.0)
Main.Manifolds.Paraboloid â€” Type
Paraboloid{T<:Real} <: EmbeddedManifold

Settings for the Paraboloid. Call Paraboloid(a,b) to generate a paraboloid with parameters a<:Real and outer radius b<:Real. Elements satisfy $(x/a)^2+(y/b)^2 = z$.

Example: Generate a torus with $a=0$ and $b=1$

julia> â„™ = Parabolod(3.0, 1.0)
Main.Manifolds.g â€” Function
g(q::T, â„³::TM) where {T<:Union{AbstractArray, Real}, TM<:EmbeddedManifold}

If â„³<:EmbeddedManifold is given in local coordinates $F:â„^d â†’ â„^N$, we obtain a Riemannian metric. g(q, â„³) returns the matrix $J^TJ$, where $J$ denotes the Jacobian matrix for $F$ in q<:Union{AbstractArray, Real}.

Main.Manifolds.Î“ â€” Function
Î“(q::T, â„³::TM) where {T<:Union{AbstractArray, Real}, TM<:EmbeddedManifold}

If â„³<:EmbeddedManifold is given in local coordinates $F:â„^d â†’ â„^N$, we obtain Christoffel symbols $Î“^i_{jk}$ for the Levi-Civita connection

In local coordinates q, Î“(q, â„³) returns a matrix of size $dÃ—dÃ—d$ where the element [i,j,k] corresponds to $Î“^i_{jk}$.
